alert.note: Alert for Austin; Brazos; Burleson; Colorado; Grimes; Waller; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 1:29PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHERN COLORADO...AUSTIN... EASTERN BURLESON...WESTERN GRIMES...BRAZOS...WASHINGTON...WESTERN WALLER AND NORTHWESTERN HARRIS COUNTIES THROUGH 215 PM CDT... At 129 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Millican to 7 miles southeast of Brenham to 13 miles southeast of Industry to near Columbus. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... College Station, Bryan, Brenham, Navasota, Sealy, Hempstead, Prairie View, Bellville, Columbus, Eagle Lake, Washington, Somerville, Pine Island, San Felipe, Snook, Industry, Wixon Valley, Millican, Anderson, and Kyle Field. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Austin; Brazos; Burleson; Colorado; Grimes; Waller; Washington
